description: Retrieves violations for a resource based on the specified Firewall Manager policy and Amazon Web Services account.

parameters.name: PolicyId
parameters.description: The ID of the Firewall Manager policy that you want the details for. You can get violation details for the following policy types: WAF DNS Firewall Imported Network Firewall Network Firewall Security group content audit Network ACL Third-party firewall.

parameters.name: MemberAccount
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID that you want the details for.

parameters.name: ResourceId
parameters.description: The ID of the resource that has violations.

parameters.name: ResourceType
parameters.description: The resource type. This is in the format shown in the Amazon Web Services Resource Types Reference. Supported resource types are: AWS::WAFv2::WebACL, AWS::EC2::Instance, AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface, AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup, AWS::NetworkFirewall::FirewallPolicy, and AWS::EC2::Subnet.

nested_items.name: ViolationDetail
nested_items.description: Violation detail for a resource.

nested_items.name: PolicyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Firewall Manager policy that the violation details were requested for.

nested_items.name: MemberAccount
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account that the violation details were requested for.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: The resource ID that the violation details were requested for.

nested_items.name: ResourceType
nested_items.description: The resource type that the violation details were requested for.

nested_items.name: ResourceViolations
nested_items.description: List of violations for the requested resource.

nested_items.name: AwsVPCSecurityGroupViolation
nested_items.description: Violation detail for security groups.

nested_items.name: ViolationTarget
nested_items.description: The security group rule that is being evaluated.

nested_items.name: ViolationTargetDescription
nested_items.description: A description of the security group that violates the policy.

nested_items.name: PartialMatches
nested_items.description: List of rules specified in the security group of the Firewall Manager policy that partially match the ViolationTarget rule.

nested_items.name: Reference
nested_items.description: The reference rule from the primary security group of the Firewall Manager policy.

nested_items.name: TargetViolationReasons
nested_items.description: The violation reason.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: PossibleSecurityGroupRemediationActions
nested_items.description: Remediation options for the rule specified in the ViolationTarget.

nested_items.name: RemediationActionType
nested_items.description: The remediation action that will be performed.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: Brief description of the action that will be performed.

nested_items.name: RemediationResult
nested_items.description: The final state of the rule specified in the ViolationTarget after it is remediated.

nested_items.name: IPV4Range
nested_items.description: The IPv4 ranges for the security group rule.

nested_items.name: IPV6Range
nested_items.description: The IPv6 ranges for the security group rule.

nested_items.name: PrefixListId
nested_items.description: The ID of the prefix list for the security group rule.

nested_items.name: Protocol
nested_items.description: The IP protocol name ( tcp, udp, icmp, icmpv6) or number.

nested_items.name: FromPort
nested_items.description: The start of the port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP/ICMPv6 type number. A value of -1 indicates all ICMP/ICMPv6 types.

nested_items.name: ToPort
nested_items.description: The end of the port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP/ICMPv6 code. A value of -1 indicates all ICMP/ICMPv6 codes.

nested_items.name: IsDefaultAction
nested_items.description: Indicates if the current action is the default action.

nested_items.name: AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation
nested_items.description: Violation detail for a network interface.

nested_items.name: ViolationTarget
nested_items.description: The resource ID of the network interface.

nested_items.name: ViolatingSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: List of security groups that violate the rules specified in the primary security group of the Firewall Manager policy.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AwsEc2InstanceViolation
nested_items.description: Violation detail for an EC2 instance.

nested_items.name: ViolationTarget
nested_items.description: The resource ID of the EC2 instance.

nested_items.name: AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolations
nested_items.description: Violation detail for network interfaces associated with the EC2 instance.

nested_items.name: ViolationTarget
nested_items.description: The resource ID of the network interface.

nested_items.name: ViolatingSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: List of security groups that violate the rules specified in the primary security group of the Firewall Manager policy.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation
nested_items.description: Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that a subnet has no Firewall Manager managed firewall in its VPC.

nested_items.name: ViolationTarget
nested_items.description: The ID of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.

nested_items.name: VPC
nested_items.description: The resource ID of the VPC associated with a violating subnet.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone of a violating subnet.

nested_items.name: TargetViolationReason
nested_items.description: The reason the resource has this violation, if one is available.

nested_items.name: NetworkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation
nested_items.description: Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that an Availability Zone is missing the expected Firewall Manager managed subnet.

nested_items.name: ViolationTarget
nested_items.description: The ID of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.

nested_items.name: VPC
nested_items.description: The resource ID of the VPC associated with a violating subnet.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone of a violating subnet.

nested_items.name: TargetViolationReason
nested_items.description: The reason the resource has this violation, if one is available.

nested_items.name: NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation
nested_items.description: Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that a subnet is not associated with the expected Firewall Manager managed route table.

nested_items.name: ViolationTarget
nested_items.description: The ID of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.

nested_items.name: VPC
nested_items.description: The resource ID of the VPC associated with a violating subnet.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone of a violating subnet.

nested_items.name: CurrentRouteTable
nested_items.description: The resource ID of the current route table that's associated with the subnet, if one is available.

nested_items.name: ExpectedRouteTable
nested_items.description: The resource ID of the route table that should be associated with the subnet.

nested_items.name: NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation
nested_items.description: Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that a firewall policy in an individual account has been modified in a way that makes it noncompliant. For example, the individual account owner might have deleted a rule group, changed the priority of a stateless rule group, or changed a policy default action.

nested_items.name: ViolationTarget
nested_items.description: The ID of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.

nested_items.name: CurrentPolicyDescription
nested_items.description: The policy that's currently in use in the individual account.

nested_items.name: StatelessRuleGroups
nested_items.description: The stateless rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall firewall policy.

nested_items.name: RuleGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the rule group.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: The resource ID of the rule group.

nested_items.name: Priority
nested_items.description: The priority of the rule group. Network Firewall evaluates the stateless rule groups in a firewall policy starting from the lowest priority setting.

nested_items.name: StatelessDefaultActions
nested_items.description: The actions to take on packets that don't match any of the stateless rule groups.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StatelessFragmentDefaultActions
nested_items.description: The actions to take on packet fragments that don't match any of the stateless rule groups.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StatelessCustomActions
nested_items.description: Names of custom actions that are available for use in the stateless default actions settings.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StatefulRuleGroups
nested_items.description: The stateful rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall firewall policy.

nested_items.name: RuleGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the rule group.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: The resource ID of the rule group.

nested_items.name: Priority
nested_items.description: An integer setting that indicates the order in which to run the stateful rule groups in a single Network Firewall firewall policy. This setting only applies to firewall policies that specify the STRICT_ORDER rule order in the stateful engine options settings.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action that changes the rule group from DROP to ALERT. This only applies to managed rule groups.

nested_items.name: StatefulDefaultActions
nested_items.description: The default actions to take on a packet that doesn't match any stateful rules. The stateful default action is optional, and is only valid when using the strict rule order.
aws:drop_strict.
aws:drop_established.
aws:alert_strict.
aws:alert_established.

nested_items.name: StatefulEngineOptions
nested_items.description: Additional options governing how Network Firewall handles stateful rules. The stateful rule groups that you use in your policy must have stateful rule options settings that are compatible with these settings.

nested_items.name: RuleOrder
nested_items.description: Indicates how to manage the order of stateful rule evaluation for the policy. Stateful rules are provided to the rule engine as Suricata compatible strings, and Suricata evaluates them based on certain settings. For more information, see Evaluation order for stateful rules in the Network Firewall Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: StreamExceptionPolicy
nested_items.description: Indicates how Network Firewall should handle traffic when a network connection breaks midstream.
DROP - Fail closed and drop all subsequent traffic going to the firewall.

CONTINUE - Continue to apply rules to subsequent traffic without context from traffic before the break. This impacts the behavior of rules that depend on context. For example, with a stateful rule that drops HTTP traffic, Network Firewall won't match subsequent traffic because the it won't have the context from session initialization, which defines the application layer protocol as HTTP. However, a TCP-layer rule using a flow:stateless rule would still match, and so would the aws:drop_strict default action.

REJECT - Fail closed and drop all subsequent traffic going to the firewall. With this option, Network Firewall also sends a TCP reject packet back to the client so the client can immediately establish a new session. With the new session, Network Firewall will have context and will apply rules appropriately. For applications that are reliant on long-lived TCP connections that trigger Gateway Load Balancer idle timeouts, this is the recommended setting.
FMS_IGNORE - Firewall Manager doesn't monitor or modify the Network Firewall stream exception policy settings.

nested_items.name: ExpectedPolicyDescription
nested_items.description: The policy that should be in use in the individual account in order to be compliant.

nested_items.name: StatelessRuleGroups
nested_items.description: The stateless rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall firewall policy.

nested_items.name: RuleGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the rule group.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: The resource ID of the rule group.

nested_items.name: Priority
nested_items.description: The priority of the rule group. Network Firewall evaluates the stateless rule groups in a firewall policy starting from the lowest priority setting.

nested_items.name: StatelessDefaultActions
nested_items.description: The actions to take on packets that don't match any of the stateless rule groups.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StatelessFragmentDefaultActions
nested_items.description: The actions to take on packet fragments that don't match any of the stateless rule groups.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StatelessCustomActions
nested_items.description: Names of custom actions that are available for use in the stateless default actions settings.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ResourceId

nested_items.name: Priority
nested_items.description: An integer setting that indicates the order in which to run the stateful rule groups in a single Network Firewall firewall policy. This setting only applies to firewall policies that specify the STRICT_ORDER rule order in the stateful engine options settings.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action that changes the rule group from DROP to ALERT. This only applies to managed rule groups.

nested_items.name: StatefulDefaultActions
nested_items.description: The default actions to take on a packet that doesn't match any stateful rules. The stateful default action is optional, and is only valid when using the strict rule order.
aws:drop_strict.
aws:drop_established.
aws:alert_strict.
aws:alert_established.

nested_items.name: StatefulEngineOptions
nested_items.description: Additional options governing how Network Firewall handles stateful rules. The stateful rule groups that you use in your policy must have stateful rule options settings that are compatible with these settings.

nested_items.name: RuleOrder
nested_items.description: Indicates how to manage the order of stateful rule evaluation for the policy. Stateful rules are provided to the rule engine as Suricata compatible strings, and Suricata evaluates them based on certain settings. For more information, see Evaluation order for stateful rules in the Network Firewall Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: StreamExceptionPolicy
nested_items.description: Indicates how Network Firewall should handle traffic when a network connection breaks midstream.
DROP - Fail closed and drop all subsequent traffic going to the firewall.

CONTINUE - Continue to apply rules to subsequent traffic without context from traffic before the break. This impacts the behavior of rules that depend on context. For example, with a stateful rule that drops HTTP traffic, Network Firewall won't match subsequent traffic because the it won't have the context from session initialization, which defines the application layer protocol as HTTP. However, a TCP-layer rule using a flow:stateless rule would still match, and so would the aws:drop_strict default action.

REJECT - Fail closed and drop all subsequent traffic going to the firewall. With this option, Network Firewall also sends a TCP reject packet back to the client so the client can immediately establish a new session. With the new session, Network Firewall will have context and will apply rules appropriately. For applications that are reliant on long-lived TCP connections that trigger Gateway Load Balancer idle timeouts, this is the recommended setting.
FMS_IGNORE - Firewall Manager doesn't monitor or modify the Network Firewall stream exception policy settings.

nested_items.description: The priority setting of the two conflicting rule groups.

nested_items.name: ConflictingPolicyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Firewall Manager DNS Firewall policy that was already applied to the VPC. This policy contains the rule group that's already associated with the VPC.

nested_items.name: UnavailablePriorities
nested_items.description: The priorities of rule groups that are already associated with the VPC. To retry your operation, choose priority settings that aren't in this list for the rule groups in your new DNS Firewall policy.
(integer) ---

nested_items.description: The reason the resource is causing this violation, if a reason is available.

nested_items.description: ICMP protocol: The ICMP type and code.

nested_items.name: Code
nested_items.description: ICMP code.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: ICMP type.

nested_items.name: Protocol
nested_items.description: The protocol number. A value of '-1' means all protocols.

nested_items.name: PortRange
nested_items.description: TCP or UDP protocols: The range of ports the rule applies to.

nested_items.name: From
nested_items.description: The beginning port number of the range.

nested_items.name: To
nested_items.description: The ending port number of the range.

nested_items.name: CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv4 network range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation.

nested_items.name: Ipv6CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv6 network range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation.

nested_items.name: RuleAction
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to allow or deny the traffic that matches the rule.

nested_items.name: Egress
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the rule is an egress, or outbound, rule (applied to traffic leaving the subnet). If it's not an egress rule, then it's an ingress, or inbound, rule.

nested_items.name: EntryRuleNumber
nested_items.description: The rule number for the entry. ACL entries are processed in ascending order by rule number. In a Firewall Manager network ACL policy, Firewall Manager assigns rule numbers.

nested_items.name: EntryType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the entry is managed by Firewall Manager or by a user, and, for Firewall Manager-managed entries, specifies whether the entry is among those that run first in the network ACL or those that run last.

nested_items.name: ExpectedEvaluationOrder
nested_items.description: The evaluation location within the ordered list of entries where the ExpectedEntry should be, according to the network ACL policy specifications.

nested_items.name: ActualEvaluationOrder
nested_items.description: The evaluation location within the ordered list of entries where the ExpectedEntry is currently located.

nested_items.name: EntryAtExpectedEvaluationOrder
nested_items.description: The entry that's currently in the ExpectedEvaluationOrder location, in place of the expected entry.

nested_items.name: ResourceTags
nested_items.description: The ResourceTag objects associated with the resource.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag key to describe a category of information, such as 'customer.' Tag keys are case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag value to describe a specific value within a category, such as 'companyA' or 'companyB.' Tag values are case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: ResourceDescription
nested_items.description: Brief description for the requested resource.
